name: National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2010. Diesel consumption; Diesel fired construction equipment; Variable power rating
description:
DESCRIPTION					
This parameterized unit process models air emissions and heat produced by a generic piece of diesel powered machinery (at least 55.9 kW (75 HP)) used during construction of buildings, roadways, infrastructure, pipelines, etc. Emission factors are for non-road equipment.

CITATION AND ASSOCIATED DOCUMENTATION
This document should be cited as: 
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2010. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data – Source: Diesel consumption; Diesel fired construction equipment; Variable power rating. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: August 2010 (version 01). Retrieved on [DATE] from [URL for this dataset].

This dataset is part of the NETL Unit Process Library.  The Library offers additional information concerning this dataset in the form of a Detailed Spreadsheet  Documentation (DS) file and a Process Documentation File (DF).  The DS file  is an Excel file that contains all of the parameters, inputs, and outputs for a given system as well as background data, calculations and quality scores.  The DF file is a PDF document that contains major assumptions and data sources that are the basis for each unit process.  The NETL Unit Process Library is located on the NETL website (netl.doe.gov) under Research / Energy Analysis / Energy Trends and Issues / Life Cycle Analysis / Unit Process Library.

This dataset was converted directly from the DS with additional supporting information provided by the DF.  Full citations for the DS and DF are given below.

DS File
National Energy Technology Laboratory (NETL). 2010. NETL Life Cycle Inventory Data – Unit Process:Diesel consumption; Diesel fired construction equipment; Variable power rating. U.S. Department of Energy, National Energy Technology Laboratory. Last Updated: August 2010 (version 01). Retrieved on 6/30/2014 from: http://www.netl.doe.gov/File%20Library/Research/Energy%20Analysis/Life%20Cycle%20Analysis/UP_Library/DS_Stage1-3_O_DieselConstructionMachinery_2010-01.xls
